publicwhip.spmotion: S1M-2.2 Mr Alex Salmond: As an amendment to the motion in the name of Mr Jim Wallace leave out all from "to" in line 5 to end and insert: "to bring forward to this Parliament proposals for the abolition of tuition fees and the re-introduction of student maintenance grants" (lodged on 19 May 1999). Supported by: John Swinney, Michael Russell, Bruce Crawford, Nicola Sturgeon, Fiona Hyslop

S1M-2.2 Mr Alex Salmond: As an amendment to the motion (S1M-2) in the name of Mr Jim Wallace, leave out all after ‘established’ to end and insert: "to bring forward to this Parliament proposals for the abolition of tuition fees and the re-introduction of student maintenance grants" (lodged on 19 May 1999). Supported by: John Swinney, Michael Russell, Bruce Crawford, Nicola Sturgeon, Fiona Hyslop.

S1M-2.2 Mr Alex Salmond: As an amendment to the motion (S1M-2) in the name of Mr Jim Wallace, leave out all after ‘established’ to end and insert: "to bring forward to this Parliament proposals for the abolition of tuition fees and the re-introduction of student maintenance grants"(lodged on 19 May 1999). Supported by: John Swinney, Michael Russell, Bruce Crawford, Nicola Sturgeon, Fiona Hyslop.

S1M-2.2 Mr Alex Salmond: As an amendment to the motion (S1M-2) in the name of Mr Jim Wallace, leave out all after ‘established’ to end and insert: "to bring forward to this Parliament proposals for the abolition of tuition fees and the re-introduction of student maintenance grants". (lodged on 19 May 1999) Supported by: John Swinney, Michael Russell, Bruce Crawford, Nicola Sturgeon, Fiona Hyslop.
